reference.Refstring: Liskin, O., Pham, R., Kiesling, S., & Schneider, K. (2014, May). Why we need a granularity concept for user stories. In International Conference on Agile Software Development (pp. 110-125). Springer, Cham.

descriptions.definition: "[...] Expected Implementation Duration [is] the estimated time (in days) that a developer or pair will need to implement a user story."
descriptions.impact: "If the estimation of implementation time for a user story exceeds a certain threshold (for example, one week or more), chances are high that it becomes more inaccurate."
